title: The Moz Blog [SEO] - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin August 6, 2005 War in Uganda SEO Events Aaron Wall has an important blog today on the subject of war in Uganda. Don't think to yourself "hey, it's not my problem," just head over to the post, read it, and form your own opinions. There's a chance for the online world to make a big difference, so let's get to it. In other news, I'm leaving for San Jose tomorrow morning ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 5, 2005 Design Principles Design Return to the roots of design for a moment and remember that the art of our development is inherently tied to specific principles that have been forged over centuries of observation and creation. Digital Web Magazine has an ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 4, 2005 Atoning for Past Sins Blogging Todd (stuntdubl) has a great post at SEW on how to make a successful re-inclusion request to Google. He notes, first off, that a customer of his got banned specifically for using Link Vault, which is new informat... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 3, 2005 In the Summertime, When the Weather is Hot... Public Relations The lazy days of summer crawl in North America & Europe, creating a bevvy of webmasters who fret and furrow their brows, wondering where the traffic has gone. This "summer slump" is an observable phenomenon every year in industries of all types as workers in t... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 2, 2005 Black Hats Hiring Public Relations There's an opening for a "Black Hat" position with a company in Toronto, ON. It looks like they're desperate, as they've opened the position to candidates worldwide. Incubator has opened a thread at SEW on the subject and is requesting e-mails go to waynec_at_yellowmediainc.com. I'm not sure if an... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 2, 2005 Update on the Sandbox Blogging Many individuals, mostly from SEOChat, having been asking me to update my Google Sandbox articles to include all of the new information, observations and hands-on experience I've got from the past 6 months. I've obliged and have created a new definition and observable phenomenon shee... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 2, 2005 Dogpile Comparison Tool Mobile SEO Hot tip from Barry Welford over at cre8asite forums. He points to Dogpile's new comparison tool that's designed to help users see why searching at Dogpile c... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 1, 2005 RSS Discussions Moz News An excellent thread at SEOChat points out the defintion of RSS (Really Simple Syndication) and how it's use in websites for SEO purposes can help to boost things like pages indexed, fresh content, and the "long tail" of search visitors. In particular, several resources were pointed to: How to ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 29, 2005 A Little Humor on a Friday SEO Events For entertainment purposes, it's really not necessary to leave the SEO forums. Case in Point - a post last night that has kept up all morning at SEOChat. There's some good back and forth on white vs. gray vs. black, and some admissions of all types from people of all types. Plus, there's a theory ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 28, 2005 Map Wars - Google Maps vs. MSN Virtual Earth Mobile SEO The map wars is on, go visit Ryan's map fight site to determine for yourself which map is better. On my short visit, Google clearly has the usability edge, while MSN is far better at finding the right location, even... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 28, 2005 Yahoo! Promoting Video Search with an Awards Site Search Engines Yahoo! is promoting, on their homepage no less, a video contest where users send in their favorite short videos - the promotion specifically features one of a bulldog riding on a skateboard. The videos are then consid... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 27, 2005 Breaking an SEO Contract Public Relations Invitationsgirl at SEOChat asks - Can I get out of my SEO Contract? There's quite a bit of good advice about contracts in general and SEO specifically in this thread, but mostly what we're seeing here is the forums serving as a business refuge and tool. There's several individuals in the thread who are p... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 27, 2005 An SEO Dream Job Public Relations While many in SEO, myself included, pride themselves on being independent contractors or owners of small firms (in my case), there are others who are seeking that prestigious, well paying position in the Internet industry that will provide security, challenges and a fun work environment. ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 26, 2005 Let's Talk about Your Workspace Moz News Today I found my way over to some of CNET's more personalized content, a section on home office pohots sent in by users. Of course, CNET offers their own guidelines as to what you should buy to improve the space, and links to the stuff you already have so readers can bu... Read this post
